intro: Grindelia aggregata, commonly known as the desert composite or desert gumplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow flowers and silvery-gray foliage. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in desert scrub and sandy soils. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas.
